alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 04 at 1:25PM CDT until September 04 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON AND WEST CENTRAL ORLEANS PARISHES... At 125 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Orleans, Metairie, Avondale, Marrero, Harvey, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Bridge City, Elmwood, River Ridge, Waggaman and New Orleans Armstrong Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 224 and 239. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
